markdownRemark.html:
When starting to learn new programming language - historically, it has became rudimentary to start with “Hello World” example, so I decided to keep this markdown file which was originally included in gatsby starter blog, but changed content to have my say.

If you are wondering how I build this blog? check Gatsby for inspiration.

Since this is my first blog I thought why not try to remember all programming languages/scripts I’ve tried my hands on: 

C
Java
Scala
Python
PHP
C#
Swift
JavaScript

It is also worth mentioning some of the programming paradigms:

  1. Imperative : Programming with an explicit sequence of commands that update state.
  2. Machine code, Assembly language
  3. Procedural : Imperative programming with procedural calls.
  4. Fortran, COBOL, Algol, Basic, C
  5. Object Oriented : Programming by defining objects that send messages to each other.
  6. Java, C++, C#, Python
  7. Declarative : Programming by specifying the result you want, not how to get it.
  8. SQL, XML (HTML)
  9. Logic : Programming by specifying a set of facts and rules.
  10. Prolog, Planner
  11. Functional : Programming with function calls that avoid any global state.
  12. Lisp, Haskell

I’ll be sharing few things from my past experience and document everything I learn.
